results.firPara: • Former player leaves role following Peru defeat
results.secPara: Dunga has been sacked as the Brazil manager two days after his side failed to get past the group stages of the Centenary Copa América. Brazil drew 0-0 with Ecuador and beat Haiti 7-1 but were beaten 1-0 by Peru and did not reach the knockout phase for the first time since 1987.
results.webTitle: Brazil sack Dunga after early Copa América exit

results.firPara: Austria were more lame ducks than dark horses as they slumped to a 2-0 defeat to unfancied Hungary in Bordeaux
results.webTitle: Austria 0-2 Hungary: Euro 2016 – as it happened

results.firPara: Adam Szalai is not exactly prolific. Hungarys No9 managed to go through the whole of last season without scoring for both the clubs he represented Hoffenheim and Hannover and he came into this tournament without a goal for his country since October 2014. This was the day, though, when fortunes changed for the man who paid for a round of the Hungarian tipple Palinka for 200 people in Budapest to celebrate their qualification for these finals.
results.secPara: A wayward free header in the first half, which ended up looking more like a clearance than an attempt on goal, betrayed a lack of confidence and Szalai waved an apologetic hand in the air early in the second half after making a pigs ear of another opportunity. Yet everything fell into place in the 62nd minute, when he nicked the ball past Robert Almer and ran into the arms of the Hungary supporters to cherish a feeling that was long overdue. It was his first goal in 39 appearances.
results.webTitle: Hungary’s Adam Szalai finds scoring touch to defeat 10-man Austria

results.firPara: As football tournaments go, Euro 2016 was always likely to surf new extremes. The largest Euros. The richest Euros. Plus, it turns out, other things too. Just five days in, laced with anxiety on other fronts, and elevated to a new pitch by the fallout from the violence in Marseille, France 2016 already feels like the most politically charged, macro-cosmically fraught European sporting event since the end of the cold war.
results.secPara: It is against this backdrop that Uefas disciplinary committee has ruled on Russias charge for its supporters role in the brutality at the Stade Vélodrome. On the face of it, a suspended ejection from Euro 2016 looks a bold, swingeing punishment. Or at least, as tough a punishment as Uefa could afford to take without stepping across the line into actually doing something concrete.
results.webTitle: Euro 2016, Russia, the World Cup, football politics and conflicting interests

results.firPara: Wes Hoolahan called it the goal of his life and on every level, it was perfect – down to the detail of his family being on the right side of the Stade de France, which allowed him to celebrate in front of them.
results.secPara: The Republic of Ireland midfielders beautifully executed half-volley against Sweden on Monday made him only the fourth player to score for his country at a European Championship finals. More importantly, it put the team 1-0 up in the 48th minute and was just reward for their dominance of the game.
results.webTitle: Wes Hoolahan says Republic of Ireland good enough to reach last 16

results.firPara: The Algeria winger Sofian Feghouli has signed for West Ham United on a free transfer from Valencia. The 26-year-old winger will officially join the club on a three-year deal on 1 July.
results.secPara: Capped 40 times by his country, he will move to the Premier League following six seasons with Valencia.
results.webTitle: Sofiane Feghouli signs for West Ham from Valencia on free transfer

results.firPara: • Wales forward stokes up rivalry before long-awaited Euro 2016 showdown
results.secPara: Gareth Bale has continued his bullishness towards England by stating none of Roy Hodgsons players are good enough to be in the Wales team.
results.webTitle: Gareth Bale says no England players would get into Wales team

results.firPara: Stoke City forward has disturbed the calm at Switzerlands camp by claiming he may declare for Kosovo after being overlooked as captain

results.firPara: Fans sang Stand up for the Ulsterman during their match against Sweden in memory to Darren Rodgers, who died in Nice while following Northern Ireland
